meta.name: keywords
meta.content: GeoNetwork opensource metadata ISO19115 ISO19139 ISO GIS remote sensing data shapefiles spatial data satellite images map maps interactive opengis geospatial CSW reference implementation mapping 19115 19139 geographic z39.50 catalog clearinghouse coverages grid raster data opensource open source network

meta.name: description
meta.content: GeoNetwork opensource provides Internet access to interactive maps, satellite imagery and related spatial databases. It's purpose is to improve access to and integrated use of spatial data and information. GeoNetwork opensource allows to easily share spatial data among different users

meta.name: DC.title
meta.content: GeoNetwork opensource portal to spatial data and information

meta.name: DC.description
meta.content: GeoNetwork opensource provides Internet access to interactive maps, satellite imagery and related spatial databases. It's purpose is to improve access to and integrated use of spatial data and information. GeoNetwork opensource allows to easily share spatial data among different users

strings.interMapInfo:
Info in interactive maps You can find interactive maps by searching in GeoNetwork for digital data with an interactive map, or directly connet to a pre-configured map server.
Supported map servers are Open GeoSpatial® Consortium compliant WMS Map Servers and ESRI® ArcIMS .
strings.keywordshelp: Select multiple keywords by holding the Ctrl-key when selecting with the mouse
strings.large_thumbnail: Click to see a large preview image
strings.localizationHelp:
Important! This form allows you to add a Key value to the database. The key can not have spaces.
After adding your key values, use the "Localization" form in the Administration panel to provide the actual name you want to be displayed on the website for the different languages.
strings.localizDes: Allows to change localized entities, like groups, categories etc...

ul.li: To improve access to and integrated use of spatial data and information
To promote multidisciplinary approaches to sustainable development
To enhance understanding of the benefits of geographic information

mainpage2.p: GeoNetwork opensource allows to easily share geographically referenced thematic information between different organizations. For more information please contact

p.font:
You can search using one of the provided options, or a combination of them.
Only results matching all criteria will be displayed.

The What? search searches for matching text in all metadata fields in GeoNetwork's content.
When entering more than one word in the Free text textbox, they will be interpreted by the system as separated by AND.

The Topic
search will find maps matching a specific topic.
The Where? search will find maps matching the bounding box of the selected area.

Selecting the option "
Including
the selected Area " will find maps that cover more than just the selected area.
For example: Regional or Global maps that, among other countries, also cover the selected country

Selecting the option "
Partially overlapping
the selected Area " will also find maps that partially cover the selected area.

strings.mainpageTitle: Find Interactive Maps, GIS datasets, Satellite Imagery and Related Applications

element.name: cellGeo

element.name: centerPt
element.label: Center point

element.name: chkPtAv

element.name: chkPtDesc

element.name: Citation

element.name: ConResult

element.label: Corner points
element.description: earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cells at opposite ends of grid coverage along two diagonals in the grid spatial dimensions. There are four corner points in a georectified grid; at least two corner points along one diagonal are required

element.name: country

element.name: CovDesc

element.name: covDim

element.name: DQAccTimeMeas

element.name: DQGridDataPosAcc

element.name: DQQuanAttAcc
element.label: Quantitative attribute accuracy

element.name: DQRelIntPosAcc

element.name: dqReport
element.label: Report

element.name: DQScope
element.label: Scope
element.description: description of the data specified by the scope

element.name: DQTempConsis
element.label: Temporal consistency

element.name: DQThemClassCor

element.description: comparison of the classes assigned to features or their attributes to a universe of discourse

element.name: DQTopConsis

element.name: extEleOb

element.description: obligation of the extended element

element.name: extEleParEnt
element.label: Parent entity
element.description: name of the metadata entity(s) under which this extended metadata element may appear. The name(s) may be standard metadata element(s) or other extended metadata element(s).

element.label: Rationale

element.label: Rule
element.description: specifies how the extended element relates to other existing elements and entities

element.name: extEleSrc
element.label: Source
element.description: name of the person or organization creating the extended element

element.label: Extent
element.description: date and time for the content of the dataset

element.name: Extent
element.label: Extent

element.label: Extension Online resource

element.name: extShortName

element.description: short form suitable for use in an implementation method such as XML or SGML. NOTE other methods may be used

element.name: falEastng
element.label: False easting
element.description: value added to all _x_ values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units

element.name: falENUnits
element.label: False easting northing units
element.description: units of false northing and false easting

element.name: falNorthng
element.label: False northing
element.description: value added to all _y_ values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units

element.name: faxNum
element.label: Facsimile
element.description: telephone number of a facsimile machine for the responsible organization or individual

element.name: featIntSet

element.name: featSet

element.description: features to which the information applies

element.name: featTypeList
element.label: The feature type list
element.description: provides information about the list of feature types with the same spatial representation

element.name: FeatTypList
element.label: Feature type list
element.description: list of names of feature types with the same spatial representation (same as spatial attributes)

element.name: FetCatDesc
element.label: Feature catalogue description
element.description: information identifying the feature catalogue

element.name: fileDecmTech
element.label: File decompression technique
element.description: recommendations of algorithms or processes that can be applied to read or expand resources to which compression techniques have been applied

element.name: filmDistInAv
element.label: Film distortion information availability
element.description: indication of whether or not Calibration Reseau information is available

element.name: Format
element.label: Format
element.description: description of the computer language construct that specifies the representation of data objects in a record, file, message, storage device or transmission channel

element.name: formatAmdNum
element.label: Amendment number
element.description: amendment number of the format version

element.name: formatName
element.label: Name
element.description: name of the data transfer format(s)

element.name: formatSpec
element.label: Specification
element.description: name of a subset, profile, or product specification of the format

element.name: formatVer
element.label: Version
element.description: version of the format (date, number, etc.)

element.name: GeoBndBox
element.label: Geographic bounding box
element.description: geographic position of the dataset

element.name: geoBox
element.label: Geographic box
element.description: minimum bounding rectangle within which data is available

element.name: geoDesc
element.label: Geographic description
element.description: description of the geographic area within which data is available

element.name: GeoDesc
element.label: Geographic description
element.description: Description of the geographic area using identifiers

element.name: geoEle
element.label: Geographic element
element.description: provides geographic component of the extent of the referring object

element.name: geoId
element.label: Geographic identifier
element.description: identifier used to represent a geographic area

element.name: geometObjs
element.label: Geometric objects
element.description: information about the geometric objects used in the dataset

element.name: GeometObjs
element.label: Geometric objects
element.description: number of objects, listed by geometric object type, used in the dataset

element.name: geoObjCnt
element.label: Geometric object count
element.description: total number of the point or vector object type occurring in the dataset

element.name: geoObjTyp
element.label: Geometric object type
element.description: name of point and vector spatial objects used to locate zero-, one-, and two-dimensional spatial locations in the dataset

element.name: Georect
element.label: Georectified
element.description: grid whose cells are regularly spaced in a geographic (i.e., lat / long) or map coordinate system defined in the Spatial Referencing System (SRS) so that any cell in the grid can be geolocated given its grid coordinate and the grid origin, cell spacing, and orientation

element.name: Georef
element.label: Georeferenceable
element.description: grid with cells irregularly spaced in any given geographic/map projection coordinate system, whose individual cells can be geolocated using geolocation information supplied with the data but cannot be geolocated from the grid properties alone

element.name: georefPars
element.label: Georeferenced parameters
element.description: terms which support grid data georeferencing

element.name: graphOver
element.label: Graphic overview
element.description: provides a graphic that illustrates the resource(s) (should include a legend for the graphic)

element.name: GridSpatRep
element.label: Grid spatial representation
element.description: information about grid spatial objects in the dataset

element.name: handDesc
element.label: Handling description
element.description: additional information about the restrictions on handling the resource

element.name: hgtProsPt
element.label: Height of prospective point above surface
element.description: height of viewpoint above the Earth, expressed in metres

element.name: idAbs
element.label: Abstract
element.description: brief narrative summary of the content of the resource(s)

element.name: idCitation
element.label: Citation
element.description: citation data for the resource(s)

element.name: idCredit
element.label: Credit
element.description: recognition of those who contributed to the resource(s)

element.name: identAuth
element.label: Authority
element.description: person or party responsible for maintenance of the namespace

element.name: identCode
element.label: Code

element.name: illAziAng

element.description: illumination azimuth measured in degrees clockwise from true north at the time the image is taken. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

element.name: illElevAng
element.label: Illumination elevation angle
element.description: illumination elevation measured in degrees clockwise from the target plane at intersection of the optical line of sight with the Earth_s surface. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

element.name: issn

element.name: keyTyp

entry.label: Creation
entry.description: date identifies when the resource was brought into existence

entry.label: Publication
entry.description: date identifies when the resource was issued

entry.label: Revision
entry.description: date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended

entry.label: Download
entry.description: online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another

entry.label: Information
entry.description: online information about the resource

entry.label: Offline Access
entry.description: online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider

entry.label: Order
entry.description: online order process for obtaining the resource

entry.label: Search
entry.description: online search interface for seeking out information about the resource

entry.label: Document Digital
entry.description: digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also)

entry.label: Document Hardcopy
entry.description: representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: Image Digital
entry.description: likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format

entry.label: Image Hardcopy
entry.description: likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Map Digital
entry.description: map represented in raster or vector form

entry.label: Map Hardcopy
entry.description: map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: Model Digital
entry.description: multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.

entry.label: Model Hardcopy
entry.description: 3-dimensional, physical model

entry.label: Profile Digital
entry.description: vertical cross-section in digital form

entry.label: Profile Hardcopy
entry.description: vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.

entry.label: Table Digital
entry.description: digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns

entry.label: Table Hardcopy
entry.description: representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed on paper, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: Video Digital
entry.description: digital video recording

entry.label: Video Hardcopy
entry.description: video recording on film

entry.label: Resource Provider
entry.description: party that supplies the resource

entry.label: Custodian
entry.description: party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource

entry.label: Owner
entry.description: party that owns the resource

entry.label: User
entry.description: party who uses the resource

entry.label: Distributor
entry.description: party who distributes the resource

entry.label: Originator
entry.description: party who created the resource

entry.label: Point Of Contact
entry.description: party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource

entry.label: Principal Investigator
entry.description: key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research.

entry.label: Processor
entry.description: party who has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified

entry.label: Publisher
entry.description: party who published the resource

entry.label: Direct Internal
entry.description: method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated

entry.label: Direct External
entry.description: method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required

entry.label: Indirect
entry.description: method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge

entry.label: Cross Reference
entry.description: reference from one dataset to another

entry.label: Larger Work Citation
entry.description: reference to a master dataset of which this one is a part

entry.label: Part Of Seamless Database
entry.description: part of same structured set of data held in a computer

entry.label: Source
entry.description: mapping and charting information from which the dataset content originates

entry.label: Stereomate
entry.description: part of a set of imagery that when used together, provides three-dimensional images

entry.label: Campaign
entry.description: series of organized planned actions

entry.label: Collection
entry.description: accumulation of datasets assembled for a specific purpose

entry.label: Exercise
entry.description: specific performance of a function or group of functions

entry.label: Experiment
entry.description: process designed to find if something is effective or valid

entry.label: Investigation

element.name: gmd:DQ_AbsoluteExternalPositionalAccuracy

element.description: closeness of reported coordinate values to values accepted as or being true

element.description: correctness of the temporal references of an item (reporting of error in time measurement)

element.description: excess data present in the dataset, as described by the scope

element.description: data absent from the dataset, as described by the scope

element.description: adherence to rules of the conceptual schema

element.name: gmd:DQ_ConformanceResult

element.name: gmd:DQ_RelativeInternalPositionalAccuracy

element.description: closeness of the relative positions of features in the scope to their respective relative positions accepted as or being true

element.name: gml:LineString
element.label: Line
element.description: A gml:LineString is a special curve that consists of a single segment with linear interpolation. It is defined by two or more coordinate tuples, with linear interpolation between them.

element.name: gml:LinearRing
element.label: Linear ring
element.description: A gml:LinearRing is defined by four or more coordinate tuples, with linear interpolation between them; the first and last coordinates shall be coincident.

entry.label: creation
entry.description: date identifies when the resource was brought into existence

entry.label: Publication
entry.description: date identifies when the resource was issued

entry.label: revision
entry.description: date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and imporved or amended

entry.label: download
entry.description: online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another

entry.label: information
entry.description: online information about the resource

entry.label: offlineAccess
entry.description: online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider

entry.label: order
entry.description: online order process for obtening the resource

entry.label: search
entry.description: online search interface for seeking out information about the resource

entry.label: documentDigital
entry.description: digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also)

entry.label: imageDigital
entry.description: representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photograhic material, or other media

entry.label: documentHardcopy
entry.description: likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format

entry.label: imageHardcopy
entry.description: likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: mapDigital
entry.description: map represented in raster or vector form

entry.label: mapHardcopy
entry.description: map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

entry.label: modelDigital
entry.description: multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.

entry.label: modelHardcopy
entry.description: 3-dimensional, physical model

entry.label: profileDigital
entry.description: vertical cross-section in digital form

entry.label: profileHardcopy
entry.description: vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.

entry.label: tableDigital
entry.description: digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns

entry.label: tableHardcopy
entry.description: representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed onpapers, photographic material, or other media

entry.label: videoDigital
entry.description: digital video recording

entry.label: videoHardcopy
entry.description: video recording on film

entry.label: resourceProvider
entry.description: party that supplies the resource

entry.label: custodian
entry.description: party that accepts accountability and responsability for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource

entry.label: owner
entry.description: party that owns the resource

entry.label: user
entry.description: party who uses the resource

entry.label: distributor

entry.label: directInternal

entry.label: farming
entry.description: rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock

entry.label: biota
entry.description: flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat

entry.label: boundaries
entry.description: legal land descriptions. Examples: political and administrative boundaries

entry.label: climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere
entry.description: processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation

entry.label: economy
entry.description: economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas

entry.label: elevation
entry.description: height above or below sea level. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products

entry.label: environment
entry.description: environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape

entry.label: Geoscientific Information
entry.description: information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth s rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion

entry.label: health
entry.description: health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services

entry.label: imageryBaseMapsEarthCover
entry.description: base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations

entry.label: intelligenceMilitary
entry.description: military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection

entry.label: inlandWaters
entry.description: inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrographic charts

entry.label: location
entry.description: positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names

entry.label: oceans
entry.description: features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters). Examples: tides, tidal waves, coastal information, reefs

entry.label: planningCadastre
entry.description: information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership

entry.label: society
entry.description: characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information

entry.label: structure
entry.description: man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers

entry.label: transportation
entry.description: means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways

entry.label: utilitiesCommunication
entry.description: energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks

entry.label: geometryOnly
entry.description: geometry objects without any additional structure which describes topology

entry.label: topology1D
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex -- commonly called chain-node topology

entry.label: planarGraph
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A planar graph is a graph that can be drawn in a plane in such a way that no two edges intersect except at a vertex.)

entry.label: fullPlanarGraph
entry.description: 2-dimensional topological complex that is planar. (A 2-dimensional topological complex is commonly called full topology in a cartographic 2D environment.)

entry.label: surfaceGraph
entry.description: 1-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface. (A geometric complex is isomorphic to a topological complex if their elements are in a one-to-one, dimensional-and boundry-preserving correspondence to one another.)

entry.label: fullSurfaceGraph
entry.description: 2-dimensional topological complex that is isomorphic to a subset of a surface

entry.label: topology3D
entry.description: 3-dimensional topological complex. (A topological complex is a collection of topological primitives that are closed under the boundary operations.)

entry.label: fullTopology3D
entry.description: complete coverage of a 3D Euclidean coordinate space

entry.label: abstract
entry.description: topological complex without any specified geometric realisation
